intro: Gerbera kraussii, commonly known as the Transvaal daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower. Gerbera kraussii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
